data.title: BellRing Brands (BRBR)
data.text:
Darcy Horn Davenport is president and chief executive officer at BellRing Brands. Darcy also serves on BellRing Brands Board of Directors. Prior to BellRing Brands, she was President of Post’s Active Nutrition Division, where she served in a variety of leadership roles in marketing and management since 2009.

Darcy started her career off in Finance with Ernst and Young but spent most of her professional life in marketing. She held various marketing roles with large companies like Dreyer’s Ice Cream to smaller start-ups including Zobmondo! Entertainment and Timbuk2 Designs. In 2009, she joined Joint Juice. She then led marketing through the Premier Protein acquisition (2011) as well as the sale to Post Holdings in 2013. In 2014, she became President of Premier Nutrition and then became the President of Post’s Active Nutrition business in 2017.

Darcy earned her undergraduate degree from Princeton University and her MBA from New York University’s Leonard N. Stern School of Business. She has served on the board of directors of Blentech Corporation since 2010.

Darcy is passionate about purpose-driven organizations where corporate culture is the fuel to the company growth. She strongly believes in employee empowerment where everyone has a voice and that better ideas come from diverse viewpoints. She is a long time athlete who now enjoys hiking and yoga and spends all of her free time with her two kids and husband.

Paul Rode is chief financial officer at BellRing Brands. With 20+ years of progressive experience with multinational public companies, his diverse industry and finance background includes operational experience with a $200 million telecom division of a Fortune 500 company and executive level financial reporting roles at $3 billion plus consumer product companies. He served as the chief financial officer of Post’s Active Nutrition business from 2015 – 2019.

Additionally, Paul was chief financial officer of Consumer Brands, a prior reporting segment of Post, from late 2014 to early 2015. He served as vice president, finance of Post from January to November 2014, and vice president, corporate development of Post from October 2013 to January 2014.

Paul drives team energy through thought leadership in efficiency and process development. He earned his undergraduate degree from the University of Kentucky and his MBA from Northwestern University’s Kellogg School of Management.

Doug Cornille is the chief growth officer at Premier Nutrition Company leading all sales and marketing functions. He oversees brand strategy, innovation and consumer insights as well as leads the sales teams and customer relationships across all PNC brands.

Doug brings a breadth of CPG experience to BellRing Brands, having held brand leadership roles at Clif Bar & Company, Nestlé and The Clorox Company. Earlier in his career, Doug was a business consultant with Accenture, and was founder and president of Data Solutions Group, a technology and business consultancy.

Doug has a BA in Business Administration from Rhodes College and an MBA in General Management from The Fuqua School of Business at Duke University. A healthy lifestyle enthusiast, Doug is an avid runner and loves traveling and experiencing cultures and cuisines around the world.

Marc is the senior vice president and general manager of international at Premier Nutrition Company. He has responsibility for leading PNC’s global expansion including Active Nutrition International in Germany. Marc previously served as general manager of Dymatize and has been part of the organization for 10 years.

Under his leadership, Dymatize transitioned from an owned-manufacturing to a 100% co-manufacture business, undertook a complete brand redesign and positioning leading to broader consumer appeal and entry into Food, Mass and Club channels and established an online and direct Amazon business, significantly increasing Dymatize’s margin and earnings. Marc has over 20 years of progressive sales leadership roles with Unilever and Henkel prior to joining Premier Nutrition Company. His responsibilities included vice president of Walmart and Sam’s Club and vice president of Grocery and Club channels.

Marc leads through empowerment and strongly believes the energy that comes from letting talented and responsible people run their business delivers superior results. He is a sports, history and music enthusiast and enjoys spending as much time as possible with his three kids and wife.

Eric Hunn is senior vice president of people at BellRing Brands. He is responsible for talent acquisition, talent development and all things people-related. His transformative efforts in performance management have helped Premier Nutrition to be listed for the fifth year in a row as a Great Place to Work™ and yielded our highest-ever engagement scores in 2019.

Prior to BellRing Brands, Eric has spent the last nine years in HR, including leading HR for a 9,000-employee region of Whole Foods and helping lead the entire HR function after its acquisition in 2017.

Eric is a leading voice in the HR community on the topic of performance management, and is a frequent keynote speaker, lecturer and panelist on the topic. He earned his undergraduate degree from UCLA, and both Master of Public Administration and Juris Doctor degrees from Syracuse University.
